00:00:16:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:16:040000.Dialogue: What if he gets something Kryptonian on it?

00:00:22:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:22:120000.Dialogue: I think we can safely assume that all Kryptonian condiments were destroyed when the planet Krypton exploded.

00:00:28:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:28:140000.Dialogue: Or it turned into mustard Kryptonite, the only way to destroy a rogue Kryptonian hotdog threatening Earth.

00:00:35:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:35:210000.Dialogue: Raj, please, let's stay serious here. Superman's body is Kryptonian, therefore his sweat is Kryptonian.

00:00:47:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:47:180000.Dialogue: He's invited for dinner in the Bottle City of Kandor. He miniaturizes himself, enters the city where he loses his superpowers. Before dinner, his host says, Who's up for a little Kryptonian tetherball? Superman says Sure, works up a sweat, comes back to Earth, his uniform now stained with indestructible Kryptonian perspiration.

00:01:09:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:09:160000.Dialogue: Superman would have taken his uniform to a Kandorian dry cleaner before he left the Bottle.

00:01:15:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:15:140000.Dialogue: Kandorian dry cl... I give up. You can't have a rational argument with this man.

00:01:22:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:22:040000.Dialogue: Isn't that the guy who won the MacArthur genius grant last year? No, not all at once.

00:01:39:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:39:050000.Dialogue: I didn't get a good look. Can I go again?

00:01:42:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:42:080000.Dialogue: - So what? His observation of high-energy positrons has provided the first conclusive evidence for the existence of galactic dark matter.

00:01:51:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:51:080000.Dialogue: I have two words for you. The first is big, the other's whoop.

00:01:55:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:55:050000.Dialogue: It is a big whoop. It made almost all the work you've done completely useless.

00:02:01:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:01:140000.Dialogue: Okay, maybe some of it, but...

00:02:04:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:04:050000.Dialogue: The guy was just in the right place, at the right time with the right paradigm-shifting reinterpretation of the universe. He got lucky.

00:02:11:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:11:180000.Dialogue: In more ways than one. He's a very handsome man.

00:02:16:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:16:060000.Dialogue: Doesn't do anything for me. If I was gonna go that way, I'm more of a Zac Efron kinda guy.

00:02:23:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:23:200000.Dialogue: Yeah, like you have a shot with Zac Efron.

00:02:27:180000.Speaker: David
00:02:27:180000.Dialogue: Excuse me... Are you Leonard Hofstadter? I'm David Underhill.

00:02:36:060000.Speaker: David
00:02:36:060000.Dialogue: Dr. Gablehauser said if I wanted to set something up in the photomultiplier lab, that you'd be able to give me a hand?

00:02:41:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:41:200000.Dialogue: - You want to work with me?

00:02:47:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:47:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, no problem. Here's my home number. Here's my cell. Here's my office. Here's my parents' number up in New Jersey.

00:02:56:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:56:100000.Dialogue: They always know how to reach me. Congratulations on the MacArthur Grant, by the way. Big fan.

00:03:11:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:11:080000.Dialogue: What are you looking at? You've never seen a hypocrite before?

00:03:39:020000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:03:39:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:39:020000.Dialogue: Trailing badly, Wolowitz needs a strike if he has any hopes of catching up with Sheldon Cooper, who is dominating in the ninth frame with a career-best 68.

00:03:57:080000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:03:57:080000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:00:000000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:00:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:00:000000.Dialogue: That doesn't count. Do over! Do over!

00:04:02:070000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:02:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:02:070000.Dialogue: There are no do-overs in Wii bowling.

00:04:05:120000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:05:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:05:120000.Dialogue: There are always do-overs when my people play sports.

00:04:10:030000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:10:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:10:030000.Dialogue: Where were you that's more important than Wii bowling night?

00:04:12:180000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:12:180000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:17:180000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:17:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:17:180000.Dialogue: Come on, it's just a video game. And we suck at it.

00:04:21:210000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:21:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:21:210000.Dialogue: Nice motivational speech from the team captain.

00:04:25:180000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:25:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:25:180000.Dialogue: - I was working with Dave Underhill.

00:04:29:030000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:29:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:29:030000.Dialogue: Dave. Sounds like Leonard's got a new BFF.

00:04:33:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:33:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:33:150000.Dialogue: Actually, he's pretty cool. Not only is he a brilliant scientist, but it turns out he's a Black Diamond skier. He collects vintage motorcycles. He plays in a rock band.

00:04:43:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:43:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:43:150000.Dialogue: So? We're in a rock band.

00:04:45:160000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:45:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:47:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:47:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:47:130000.Dialogue: We play Rock Band on our X-Box.

00:04:50:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:50:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:50:230000.Dialogue: Nice motivational speech from our lead guitarist.

00:04:54:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:04:54:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:54:110000.Dialogue: He's funny, too. He does this hysterical impersonation of Stephen Hawking having phone sex.

00:05:01:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:05:01:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:05:000000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:05:05:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:05:000000.Dialogue: That's not... He does it better.

00:05:07:100000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:05:07:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:07:100000.Dialogue: He said he was gonna take me to the gym tomorrow, so I'm gonna go practice my situps.

00:05:13:200000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:05:13:200000.Speaker: Raj

00:05:16:100000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:05:16:100000.Speaker: Howard

00:05:20:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:05:20:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:20:150000.Dialogue: Are you and Leonard putting up a Christmas tree?

00:05:23:010000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:05:23:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:23:010000.Dialogue: No, because we don't celebrate the ancient pagan festival of Saturnalia.

00:05:28:210000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:05:28:210000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:36:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:05:36:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:36:130000.Dialogue: In the pre-Christian era, as the winter solstice approached and the plants died, pagans brought evergreen boughs into their homes as an act of sympathetic magic, intended to guard the life essences of the plants until spring. This custom was later appropriated by Northern Europeans and eventually it becomes the so-called Christmas tree.

00:05:55:180000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:05:55:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:55:180000.Dialogue: And that, Charlie Brown, is what boredom is all about.

00:06:01:100000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:01:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:01:100000.Dialogue: Thank you for that, but I got you and Leonard a few silly neighbor gifts, so I'll just put them under my tree.

00:06:06:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:06:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:06:090000.Dialogue: Wait! You bought me a present? Why would you do such a thing?

00:06:13:100000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:13:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:06:15:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:15:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:15:230000.Dialogue: I know you think you're being generous, but the foundation of gift-giving is reciprocity. You haven't given me a gift. You've given me an obligation.

00:06:26:070000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:26:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:26:070000.Dialogue: Don't feel bad, Penny, it's a classic rookie mistake. My first Hanukah with Sheldon, he yelled at me for eight nights.

00:06:34:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:34:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:34:090000.Dialogue: You don't have to get me anything in return.

00:06:36:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:36:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:36:150000.Dialogue: Of course I do. The essence of the custom is that I now have to go out and purchase a gift of commensurate value and representing the same perceived level of friendship as that represented by the gift you've given me.

00:06:48:010000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:48:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:48:010000.Dialogue: It's no wonder suicide rates skyrocket this time of year.

00:06:52:040000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:52:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:52:040000.Dialogue: Forget it. I'm not giving you a present.

00:06:54:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:54:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:54:050000.Dialogue: It's too late. I see it. That elf sticker says, To Sheldon.

00:06:58:220000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:06:58:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:58:220000.Dialogue: The die has been cast. The moving finger has writ, Hannibal has crossed the Alps.

00:07:05:100000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:07:05:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:05:100000.Dialogue: I know. It's funny when it's not happening to us.

00:07:10:160000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:07:10:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:10:160000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I am very, very sorry.

00:07:13:100000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:07:13:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:13:100000.Dialogue: No, I brought this on myself by being such an endearing and important part of your life.

00:07:19:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:07:19:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:19:230000.Dialogue: I'm going to need a ride to the mall.

00:07:23:080000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Wii bowling.
00:07:23:080000.Speaker: Howard

00:07:34:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:34:140000.Dialogue: Thanks for letting me try out your motorcycle.

00:07:39:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:39:130000.Dialogue: I had no idea it was so heavy.

00:07:42:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:42:120000.Dialogue: The thing just fell right over on me, didn't it?

00:07:45:100000.Speaker: David
00:07:45:100000.Dialogue: Yeah. Lucky for you it wasn't moving.

00:07:51:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:51:070000.Dialogue: It's just a little motorcycle accident.

00:07:53:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:53:120000.Dialogue: My God, how fast were you going?

00:07:55:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:55:140000.Dialogue: I don't know. It's all such a blur.

00:07:59:150000.Speaker: David
00:07:59:150000.Dialogue: Good one. He couldn't even get it started.

00:08:02:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:02:090000.Dialogue: - Hi. Penny. So it's your motorcycle? - Is it okay?

00:08:10:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:10:020000.Dialogue: Lucky for the bike it landed on my leg.

00:08:13:220000.Speaker: David
00:08:13:220000.Dialogue: You mind giving me a hand with Speed Racer here?

00:08:25:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:25:110000.Dialogue: Well, it's just that the physicists I know are indoorsy and pale.

00:08:31:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:31:190000.Dialogue: I'm not indoorsy. I just wear the appropriate sun block because I don't take melanoma lightly.

00:08:37:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:37:070000.Dialogue: So, are you and Leonard working on an experiment together?

00:08:40:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:40:010000.Dialogue: - We're examining the radiation levels of photomultiplier tubes for a new dark matter detector.

00:08:53:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:53:130000.Dialogue: Call me a geek, but I am just nuts for the whole subatomic particle thing.

00:08:58:110000.Speaker: David
00:08:58:110000.Dialogue: The last thing I would ever call you is a geek.

00:09:01:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:01:050000.Dialogue: Well, that's what I am... queen of the nerds.

00:09:05:130000.Speaker: David
00:09:05:130000.Dialogue: If you like, I could show you the lab we're working in. We've got some cool toys, you know, lasers and stuff.

00:09:10:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:10:140000.Dialogue: You know, I have always wanted to see a big science lab.

00:09:24:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:24:140000.Dialogue: Yeah, that sounds great. Let me just get my jacket.

00:09:34:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:34:180000.Dialogue: Yeah, if you like that type.

00:09:53:110000.Speaker: David
00:09:53:110000.Dialogue: - All right. - See you tomorrow, Leonard.

00:10:25:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:25:140000.Dialogue: I don't see anything in here a woman would want.

00:10:29:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:29:170000.Dialogue: You're kidding. You've got lotions and bath oils and soaps. That's the estrogen hat trick.

00:10:38:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:38:150000.Dialogue: What it is is a cacophonous assault of eucalyptus, bayberry, cinnamon and vanilla.

00:10:44:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:44:210000.Dialogue: It's as if my head were trapped in the pajamas of a sultan.

00:10:48:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:48:230000.Dialogue: If you don't like this stuff, let's go next door and build her a bear.

00:10:53:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:53:210000.Dialogue: I told you before, bears are terrifying.

00:10:58:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:58:000000.Dialogue: Come on, bath stuff. It's perfect! You got a scented candle, a cleansing buff, spearmint and green tea scented bath oil, promotes relaxation.

00:11:08:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:08:090000.Dialogue: She knows you. She's tense. We all are. Buy a basket!

00:11:24:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:24:130000.Dialogue: - You put no thought into that.

00:11:31:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:31:190000.Dialogue: I have insufficient data to proceed. Excuse me, miss? If I were to give you this gift basket, based on that action alone and no other data, infer and describe the hypothetical relationship that exists between us.

00:11:49:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:49:230000.Dialogue: Here. Now, are we friends? Colleagues? Lovers?

00:12:00:080000.Speaker: Assistant
00:12:00:080000.Dialogue: I don't understand what you're talking about and you're making me a little uncomfortable.

00:12:05:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:05:170000.Dialogue: See? Sounds just like you and Penny. We'll take it.

00:12:19:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:19:170000.Dialogue: Dave was just showing me around the university. This place is unbelievable!

00:12:23:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:23:100000.Dialogue: I know, I've been offering to show you around for a year and a half.

00:12:27:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:27:110000.Dialogue: You always said you had yoga.

00:12:36:110000.Speaker: David
00:12:36:110000.Dialogue: This is an amazing woman. She has a curious and agile mind, not to mention being curious and agile in other respects.

00:12:48:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:48:210000.Dialogue: So... Dave, don't you think you and I should get back to the lab? You know, that dark matter isn't going to detect itself.

00:12:59:000000.Speaker: David
00:12:59:000000.Dialogue: Actually, I was thinking about taking the afternoon off so I could work on another experiment with Penny.

00:13:03:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:03:110000.Dialogue: Really? We're going to do an experiment?

00:13:05:180000.Speaker: David
00:13:05:180000.Dialogue: We're going to explore the effects of tequila shots on a gorgeous 22-year-old woman.

00:13:10:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:10:110000.Dialogue: It's not an experiment! You saw what happened last night.

00:13:15:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:15:080000.Dialogue: - Yeah. - Can I drive the motorcycle?

00:13:16:210000.Speaker: David
00:13:16:210000.Dialogue: - Yeah, why not? You can't do any worse than Leonard.

00:13:26:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:26:160000.Dialogue: By the way, my leg is killing me. Thanks for asking.

00:13:53:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:53:070000.Dialogue: Great news, Leonard. I've solved my Penny gift dilemma.

00:13:59:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:59:070000.Dialogue: You see, the danger was that I might under or over-reciprocate, but I have devised a foolproof plan. See, I will open her gift to me first and then excuse myself, feigning digestive distress.

00:14:10:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:10:100000.Dialogue: Then... I'll look up the price of her gift online, choose the basket closest to that value, give it to her and then I'll return the others for a full refund.

00:14:23:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:23:170000.Dialogue: It is, isn't it? Is it okay if I hide them in your room? The smell makes me nauseated.

00:14:42:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:42:020000.Dialogue: Why couldn't you have just done what Leonard did and get Penny a new boyfriend?

00:14:50:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:50:150000.Dialogue: My leg is killing me. Thanks for asking.

00:15:04:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:04:210000.Dialogue: I have just one question for you. While I am perfectly happy with the way things are between us, you said you didn't want to go out with me because I was too smart for you! News flash, lady: David Underhill is ten times smarter than me! You'd have to drive a railroad spike into his brain for me to beat him at checkers!

00:15:23:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:23:150000.Dialogue: Next to him, I'm like one of those sign-language gorillas who knows how to ask for grapes!

00:15:29:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:29:080000.Dialogue: So, my question is... What's up with that?!

00:15:36:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:36:030000.Dialogue: Why are you yelling at me?

00:15:38:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:38:130000.Dialogue: Sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry! Never mind, we're cool.

00:15:43:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:43:020000.Dialogue: Dave is not smarter than you. He's an idiot.

00:15:46:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:46:180000.Dialogue: Really? Why would you say that?

00:15:49:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:49:090000.Dialogue: Because a smart guy takes the nude photos of his wife off his cell phone before he tries to take nude photos of his girlfriend.

00:15:58:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:58:150000.Dialogue: He tried to take nude photos of you?

00:16:01:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:01:090000.Dialogue: That's what you took from that?!

00:16:13:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:13:050000.Dialogue: And you, if you are so okay with the way things are between us, why are you so jealous?

00:16:20:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:20:090000.Dialogue: The important thing is he's married and that's terrible!

00:16:33:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:33:120000.Dialogue: It's just rum. It stopped being eggnog like half an hour ago.

00:16:48:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:48:130000.Dialogue: Come on, it's Christmas, just give me this one.

00:17:01:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:01:150000.Dialogue: By the way, my leg is killing me. Thanks for asking.

00:17:13:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:17:13:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:15:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:17:15:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:15:110000.Dialogue: Very good, thanks for asking. Come on in.

00:17:19:160000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:17:19:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:19:160000.Dialogue: Good, Penny, you're here to exchange gifts.

00:17:26:000000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:17:26:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:26:000000.Dialogue: You'll be pleased to know I'm prepared for whatever you have to offer.

00:17:30:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:17:30:210000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:35:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:17:35:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:35:230000.Dialogue: I should note I'm having some digestive distress,

00:17:41:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:17:41:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:41:070000.Dialogue: so, if I excuse myself abruptly, don't be alarmed.

00:17:54:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:17:54:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:58:070000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:17:58:070000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:06:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:18:06:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:06:110000.Dialogue: To Sheldon, live long and prosper. Leonard Nimoy.

00:18:16:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:18:16:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:16:230000.Dialogue: He came into the restaurant. Sorry the napkin's dirty. He wiped his mouth with it.

00:18:26:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:18:26:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:26:050000.Dialogue: I possess the DNA of Leonard Nimoy?!

00:18:38:120000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:18:38:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:38:120000.Dialogue: Yeah, I guess. But look, he signed it.

00:18:41:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:18:41:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:41:080000.Dialogue: Do you realize what this means?!

00:18:46:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:18:46:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:46:060000.Dialogue: All I need is a healthy ovum and I can grow my own Leonard Nimoy!

00:18:56:090000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:18:56:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:56:090000.Dialogue: All I'm giving you is the napkin, Sheldon.

00:19:01:230000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
00:19:01:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:06:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
